author: stknohg
body:
Hi.

Since [PowerShell Core 6.1.0-preview.3](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v6.1.0-preview.3), the preview release package has been separated into `powershell-preview`.  
Will `powershell-preview` package includes stable version?

In tabular form, It is expressed below.

|Version| `powershell` package | `powershell-preview` package |
|:--:|:--:|:--:|
|6.0.2|available|-|
|6.1.0-preview.3|-|available|
|6.1.0|available|__Here is my question. available?__|
|6.2.0-preview.x|-|available|
|6.2.0|available|__Here is my question. available?__|

comments.author: stknohg
comments.body:
This question was solved with the release of PowerShell Core 6.1.  
`powershell-preview` package doesn't include stable version.

|Version| `powershell` package | `powershell-preview` package |
|:--:|:--:|:--:|
|6.0.2|available|-|
|6.1.0-preview.3|-|available|
|6.1.0|available|__(not available)__|
|6.2.0-preview.x|-|available|
|6.2.0|available|__(not available)__|

title: Will 'powershell-preview' package includes stable version?
